Reviews.Title: “Will stay elsewhere if I have more $”
Reviews.Author: eliaw
Reviews.Content: Location is not so good.. Not near main train station, and also not near to Venice town. Bus service was prompt, but takes 10-15 min to Venice. Rooms were not heated. We went in spring n temperature at night was 6 degrees, was raining a lot n the rooms were so cold in the middle of the night. Room cleanliness was average. Breakfast selection was good. Bread rolls were freshly baked n warm.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, value for money, free parking”
Reviews.Author: getaway25
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very comfortable. The rooms were quite spacious and a nice modern bathroom. Breakfast was more than adequate,with internet available in the sitting room. The owner spoke good english and was very helpful. It was very conveniently located to the bus stop which was just a minute away. Venice was about 15 to 20 minutes away by bus and there were plenty of buses available at night. It was great to be able to park the car securely on the property and use the public transport. I would recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and affordable”
Reviews.Author: rmy_fernandes
Reviews.Content: Close to Venice minus the exorbitant prices. Room was clean and comfortable enough for the price we paid. Quiet location, famous pizza place next door. We took a direct bus from the airport. The gentleman at the reception at night may not prove too helpful with touristic information, but the lady is excellent. Following her directions and tips, we had a wonderful day. Ample, sufficient breakfast at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “very bad”
Reviews.Author: amon862
Reviews.Content: our room very dirty,reception not friendly,breakfast bad,dirty,coffee very bad,.night very laud,can not sleep.never again.other hotels in venedig befor were much better.mostly no englich spoken.area not so nice.only o.k for poor students.no internet possible ?.food-breakfast,evry day same,no dark bread,no saccarin,very simpel,littel breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Fits the bill for the biennale in November”
Reviews.Author: Brian S
Reviews.Content: Good friendly service. Tried two of the recommended nearby restaurants with good results. The pizza was pretty ordinary though. Beware Norwegian scampy is really crayfish with very little meat in it. Buses 4 and 19 to Venice on the doorstep. the 4 takes a long time so avoid. A travel pass at the airport gets you on all buses and water buses. choose according to length of stay. Shops sell single trip tickets.

Reviews.Title: “Good access to Venice and the airport”
Reviews.Author: mypointofviewis
Reviews.Content: This hotel is on the outskirts of Venice and has easy access to the city and to the airport. It is good value for money. The breakfast is good and the staff excellent. The manager/owner recommended Trattoria Alla Pesa as a place to eat, and the food there was excellent. He also arranged a taxi to the airport for us the next day. The only downside was that there were only two hangers in the wardrobe, fine for a one night stay but not for longer. This is nit-picking and I would recommend this hotel as a less expensive alternative to staying in Venice itself.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay here”
Reviews.Author: jockeygirl
Reviews.Content: The rooms are large with nice bathroom, breakfast really good, nice and clean with free transport to Venice historic centre and a really good restaurant recommended Trattoria Alla Pesa just down the road with the best seafood dishes for under 30euro for two with a litre of wine and cafe. Great little bar nearby Sole luna with free nibbles and drinks are only from .70 euro to 1.50 euro.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel owner could not do enough for his guests!”
Reviews.Author: jim s
Reviews.Content: From the moment we stepped through the door we were looked after as if we were at the Dorchester. Our last hotel that we stayed in at Florence was terrible and this hotel was the complete opposite. It was immaculately clean and the owner of the hotel constantly helped us throughout our stay and was a fountain of knowledge with regards to getting around and seeing the sights. He had a very pleasant nature and his whole family was pleasant and sociable as well. We initially thought they were guests as they mingled amongst other guests but not intrusively.We ended up socialising with the family and the owner even bought us a bottle of wine. Okay it was only 8 euros but still, he didn't have to do this and he's running a business at the end of the day. Putting it simply, he's just a very nice guy, who looks after his guests and can't do enough for them. I can't recommend this place enough and I saw him being the same with other guests. If I was going back to Venice I would stay here again and recommend you stay here. The bus stop is just a few yards down the road and costs just over a euro each way into Venice and only takes 15 minutes,but it works out at much better value. Thanks for such an enjoyable stay!

Reviews.Title: “A very good hotel.”
Reviews.Author: bron1960
Reviews.Content: This is a very well run hotel. Guests are treated promptly and efficiently. The rooms are of good size and the free wifi is fast. Breakfast was good with choices of cereal, meat, cheese, yoghurt, rolls and croissants available. The hotel was in a very nice part of Venice. There is a laundry down the road and a good choice of restaurants, shops and cafes.

Reviews.Title: “No frills but good service!”
Reviews.Author: Shacheb75
Reviews.Content: My husband and I needed a hotel to stay for one night before our cruise and one night after our cruise. We stayed at the Hotel Altieri. It is a no frills hotel. You have a standard room with a bathroom. Everything is clean. The breakfast was hearty. The staff was very helpful and gracious. My husband lost his phone and they found it and it kept it until we returned the following week. Very friendly and helpful. The bus stop is about two minutes away and the bus runs very frequently. The number 19. Very accessible to Venice with no trouble at all. Only thing is you can't get wifi in the rooms. You have to go into the common areas to pick up the signal. However, we stayed in room 102 on our last night there, which is right at the front of the hotel and we were able to get the signal from that room. The other thingis the walls are a bit thin. It was a good stay overall though. If you are looking for the Hilton or Holiday Inn this isn't it. But if you are looking for a place to crash that is cheap, clean, accessible and friendly this is the place!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Accomodations, Easy Access to Venice”
Reviews.Author: Jim K
Reviews.Content: My family of 5 stayed 2 nights at the Hotel Altieri while visiting the island of Venice. The hotel is in good shape, and the free parking was a very nice feature. Service was very good also.

Reviews.Title: “Nice inexpensive alternative to Venice hotels”
Reviews.Author: HunkyJoe
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Altieri Hotel because of its access by auto and the price. The hotel is located in a suburb of Venice. Venice is accessable via bus, which stops a block from the hotel. The room was very basic, but clean. The staff, clerks and waitresses were friendly and helpful. The included breakfast was very nice. We included Venice on our European trip, as when visiting Italy, we had to at least visit. I have to say we encountered the most ignorant people on this part of our trip. The service people, store clerks, waiters, bus drivers were without exceptionally nasty. They not only made no effort to please, they actually tried to make things miserable. The bus drivers here on all of our trips, either gave us a hard time, and even gave us incorrect information on purpose. During our entire trip through 11 countries we encountered nothing but friendly and helpful people. This observation does not apply to the general public in Venice, as all that we met tried to give us information, even though most spoke no english.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliante!”
Reviews.Author: lcts2
Reviews.Content: This hotel ticked all our boxes. The room was spacious, well air conditioned, comfortable, had constant hot water and was spotlessly clean. The staff were fantastic and in particular Susannah who went above and beyond to help us make the most of our 5 day holiday...they genuinely just want to help and make sure you have the best time there. Although the hotel is not in the centre of Venice, we had no issues catching the regular bus from just outside the hotel, taking us directly there in around 15 minutes. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. Such good value for money and if we ever return to Venice we would definitely choose to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: ManzoorMissouri
Reviews.Content: I know there were some positive reviews for this hotel, but you need to put them into context and it all depends on your need. During our four week vacation, we've been to many places and stayed at ten different hotels. This is by far the worst hotel I've stayed at, perhaps the worst in my life. The hotel owner or manager, a middle-age gentleman who runs the hotel with his wife and son, is extremely rude and has no idea what customer service means. Upon arrival we discovered that there were no towels in our room. When I asked, I was told that because I've booked the hotel using a particular website, I'll have to pay extra for our towels. Even if that was true, a good hotel would give its customers break who have just arrived from a long flight. We're talking about towels only, not free breakfast. This is only one example, I can write ten pages describing our bad experience at this hotel. One morning when I asked the owner about going to Florence (which train station would be better) he said I'm a smart American and I should be able to figure this out! So, here is my advice - stay closer to Venice (not necessarily at the heart of Venice which can be expensive), choose another hotel other than this one. There are tons of hotel in this price range where they will treat you better.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Review”
Reviews.Author: RonaldD7
Reviews.Content: A hotel with no beer. Hotel chosen because close to airport and price was cheap compared to other Venice options. Should look at providing tea/coffee facilities in rooms or elsewhere. Also extremely hot with no fridge facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Goodlocation for Venice, helpful staff, but!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: novamundial
Reviews.Content: good location for visiting Venice, helpful staff. Nice cold buffett breakfast, good restaraunt bottom of the road turn left and its just past the supermarket/shopping complex. grubby looking from the outside, and got worse on the inside, the pink painted furniture did not help. glad we only stayed one night

Reviews.Title: “Family run, great value, great breakfast and conveniently located hotel!”
Reviews.Author: EmilyandMattLondon
Reviews.Content: Found this place through laterooms, and we were very glad we did. Run by what appears to be a family unit, the hotel was clean, comfortable, and had a great and filling breakfast (yoghurts, bread, croissants, eggs, cold meat and cheese, and all manner of condiments) that was open from 7 to 10am. The room was definitely large enough, and we even had our own little balcony. Bathroom had everything you would need, and it was a comfortable night's sleep. Bus number 19 took you right to Venice in less than half an hour, and for only 1.20 euros. The staff were friendly, and were able to give us good recommendations for places to eat in the Favaro area (including the trattoria mentioned below that we would also vouch for!).

Reviews.Title: “Nice and convenient”
Reviews.Author: Nishman
Reviews.Content: The rooms are large, clean and quiet. The staff is efficient and friendly. The buffet breakfast is very good and plentiful. It's a non-smoking place but ashtrays are available at the gate. However the wifi connection is very bad, even in the lobby. There's a safe and large open carpark and the bus stop to Venice is only a few meters away. It's a short ride to the "cat city" and buses are available until late at night.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly, easy access to Venice!”
Reviews.Author: aechristie
Reviews.Content: I stayed at hotel Altieri with two other girlfriends on our holiday from uni in the UK. We are extremely picky when it comes to hotels and were thrilled with our stay here. It was such a great value, cheaper for the three of us than for a hostel. The staff spoke english, and were very helpful. The bus to venice came steps from the hotel (every 15min) and it was a 20min ride. Tickets were only a euro, but you really dont need to buy one. The hotel is also in a nice neighborhood. We had no problem walking around during the day, and felt safe at night. I got the vibe it was a family run hotel which made up feel very comfortable. Breakfast was also good!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location - near to airport and very easy to get into Venice from here”
Reviews.Author: pembrokegirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 25th to 29th April and had a brilliant stay. The rooms are fairly basic but very reasonable and the breakfasts are good - enough to keep you well fed until tea time! The owner was very friendly and approachable offering advice to getting buses and tickets and eating out near the hotel. No tea/coffee making facilities in room being the only little down side. Other hotel staff were also very friendly. We had a bit of trouble getting on right bus from the airport as the numbers had changed recently and info we'd read prior to arriving was a little misleading, but on our way back to airport it was very straightforward and only probably a 5 min journey. The no. 19 bus (stop on the same side as hotel just a little further down) takes you into Venice and comes every 10 mins. We got ACTV bus tickets which you can buy for single journeys for one euro twenty or for longer periods. We got ones for 36 hours which cost 23 euros which were brilliant as you can use on land and water buses. You can buy these from many places - we found a good little yellow information kiosk by the main Venice bus station with no queues unlike the main ticket places! We ate at a local trattoria about 10 mins walk away from hotel next to the shopping centre La Piazza. Coming out of hotel turn right and walk to end and then turn left past the Ducale hotel and further along road past La Piazza, and you will find Pizzeria da Piero where we enjoyed two super - very filling-meals with lovely staff. A really lovely 4 night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very cozy and comfortable family hotel”
Reviews.Author: Florentian
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 1 night, that is, spent less than 24 hours. Nevertheless, we grade the hotel high - it is clean, comfortable, with good breakfast. The room is small but we returned to the hotel from Venice only by night, and in the morning, after breakfast, checked out. The bathroom is also small but clean, having practically all the things needed - soap, shower gel, hair-dryer, set of long and short towels. At night, there was no noice around the hotel as it is situated in a restful spot. It was convenient to reach Venice as well as the railway station in Mestre by bus. The hotel staff was very polite and helpful. I would definitely recommend this hotel to a friend, and, moreover, will stay there in our next visit to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Excelence experience”
Reviews.Author: cheragh
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel because of good review in tripadvisor and I was not disappointed. This hotel is not in Venice. It's 20 minutes commute by bus but I found it very convenient and I had no issue commuting back and forth to Venice. They also gave me free bus ticket! The breakfast was excellent. All of the staff speak very good English and they are very helpful. My room was very clean and the bed was also comfy. (Well, don't expect 5 star hotel kind of bed) There is free wifi access. Here is one negative side. Sometimes, I had hard time getting wifi access in my room but I was able to use it in lobby. So, don't count on using wifi at your own room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Price and Room”
Reviews.Author: sabrina_joe
Reviews.Content: Hotel Altieri is close to the Marco Polo Airport which makes having an early flight convenient. The staff is very helpful and friendly. The rooms are large and nicely decorated. They offer complimentary breakfast and free wifi. It is not located in Venice but again, if you have an early flight, you might not want to stay there. It is close using the city bus though and tickets cost 1,20 euros. We would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, value-for-the-money, family-run hotel!”
Reviews.Author: KSandZH
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a nice family run place, well connected, with several bus lines passing near by. The room was clean and basic but with enough space to move around. The staff of the hotel was great! They were willing to help us with any question and always had a positive attitude. Maybe they could make ice available to their guests. When we asked for it, it was available only in very limited amount (enough for one drink). Found it strange that guests are not permitted to eat in the rooms. The complimentary bottle of local wine that we received upon checkout was a nice gesture. Breakfast was satisfactory with the highlight being the freshly baked croissants. Free internet and parking added value to our stay. We would not hesitate to go back due to the overall friendly service, good value, location and cleanliness.

Reviews.Title: “Handy for the airport.”
Reviews.Author: mj_reynolds058
Reviews.Content: This was a last minute booking whilst I was already in Venice. I stayed at this hotel the night before I had to get a flight, the airport is a short bus ride away (max 10 minutes). Very good value for money and it also included a continental breakfast. The hotel itself was a bit out dated, it could do with being modernised and all of the fixtures and fittings being replaced. In my bathroom lightbulbs were missing, the towel holder fell off it you touched it and the shower needed a good clean. Because of the visual impact I felt that the hotel room was dirty, it had clean sheets and towels but still I couldn't relax. It is a three star which I think is a bit too high but for the money I paid and its location to airport it is a good deal. Maybe I was expecting too much as I stayed in another hotel in Mestre which is about 5 minutes away which was also three star but was pure luxery.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money - if you don't mind extra bus travel”
Reviews.Author: Bithovan
Reviews.Content: (+) Attractive price (+) Close to the airport, if that is important to you. (+) Friendly service. (-) Give yourself 30 to 40 minutes in the bus to reach Venice. I thought Bus No.19 was faster than No.4, although the frequency was less. (-) Check the timings of the last bus from Venice to return back to the hotel. (-) Nothing much to do around the neighbourhood

Reviews.Title: “Best value hotel in the VENICE AREA”
Reviews.Author: tasmike
Reviews.Content: lovely hotel (with a lift). Exellent staff especially Susan also Georgio was most helpfull. Not 5 star but this must be the best value in Venice @ only 65 Euros per double per night with a fantastic breakfast. Step out of the front door onto a bus for a 10-15 min ride into the heart of Venice.We got a 12 hr ticket (approx. 12 Euros ) wich covered all road & Grand canal waterways.Definately the way to go.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: vcollins
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Altieri offered brilliant value for money. O.K. it is a 20 - 25 min bus ride into Pza. Roma (The centre of Venice),but the bus stop is 5 mins walk from the hotel,and the buses run every 15 mins. Rooms were sizeable enough, continental breakfast was more than adequate,and the staff were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Well Looked After”
Reviews.Author: Holly02
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a great, last minute booking and I felt extremely well looked after. Susanna and her family were incredibly helpful in giving all information about sightseeing and travel in Venice. The rooms were spacious and very clean, although walls a little thin and noises carried and it would have been nice to have had tea/coffee making facilities in the room. However, it was a very pleasant week long stay. There were plenty of buses into the centre of Venice (although the journey was around 40 minutes) and I'd definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “very good for the price!”
Reviews.Author: jonnahLeics
Reviews.Content: The rooms at this hotel are very basic but ideal for a city break to Venice, although you could hear other guests moving their furtniture about as the rooms are rather empty and echo. The rooms are very clean and the bathroom is spacious with a hair dryer. The only complaint is that there aren't any tea or coffee making facilities in the room which i found to be a disapointment as its nice after a long day to come back and relax. The breakfast was lovely (and i could have my morning coffee then!). I would also advise you take some books or magazines to read as there are no English speaking channels on the television. The only other thing i would mention is that there isn't much to do around the hotel at night. But if you take a left when you leave the hotel and walk straight up that road for about ten minutes you will find a lovely Italian restaurant. Not geared up for tourists and they serve lovely food!! A lot of local Italians used this so felt it must be good! As you will have read in other reveiws, the bus service into Venice is excellent and very easy. Overall, we enjoyed our stay here! The staff were fantastic and always wanted to help.

Reviews.Title: “What a find the Hotel Altieri was!”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravel2010UK
Reviews.Content: Yes, it's in the suburb of Favaro Veneto, but we had 5 nights bed and breakfast during the Carnevale Maschere for less than what it would have cost for one night in Venice centre. A delightful family run hotel and without exception, every staff member was friendly and helpful. The room was quiet, spotless, spacious and airy with heating/air-conditioning, and the bathroom provided a hairdryer and a shower with great pressure and plenty of hot water. Continental breakfast is served in a bright sunny room and consists of the usual choices accompanied by excellent coffee - not your weak filter, although a 'tall' coffee is available. The area is safe and residential, with a few shops and bars. Eating places are few (there is the option of eating in Venice centre before returning to the hotel), although I can highly recommend 'Jungle Pizza' which is about 30m from the hotel - huge choice of inexpensive, delicious pizzas and friendly staff. Next door is the excellent 'America Bar Onde Rock', obviously the place to drop in after work and have a drink with friends before heading home. Everybody seemed to know somebody else, but we were made to feel very welcome. Drinks are accompanied by a bowl of snacks and are inexpensive - try the local Prosecco, a Bellini or the drink of choice, a Spritzer. Practicalities. The taxi from the airport cost EUR30, but only EUR1.10 each on Bus 15 (public bus so nowhere specifically for luggage) going back. We arrived at night and didn't know where we were going, so the taxi was easier at that point, but next day we found our bearings and public transport was the way to go. Bus tickets are EUR1.10 each (or a carnet of 10 tickets for EUR10) and can be bought from the Tabacchi (you can't buy them on the bus) opposite the Hotel Ducale about 80m away (turn right upon leaving the Hotel Altieri and head to the end of the road). Upon entering the bus, you need to swipe the ticket over the scanner. Bus 19 (on the same side as Hotel Altieri about 15m before the Hotel Ducale) runs every 30mins and takes about 20mins into Piazzale Roma. Around the corner, is the Pastrello stop and from here you catch Bus 4 or 4/ which runs every 7mins and takes about 30mins. Time your journey outside of rush-hour and you should get a seat, although many seem perfectly happy to stand. On the canals, the Vaporettos are EUR6.50 each way, but if you plan on using a few, consider the Travel Card (incl bus and vaporetto), starting from EUR16 for 12hrs. Fair enough if you want to pay a fortune for a central hotel (and still drag your suitcase through the narrow streets), but I'd prefer to spend the savings on daily expenses. So if you are looking for a friendly hotel which offers the best value, and is located on good bus routes, then look no further than Hotel Altieri. I'll be staying nowhere else.

Reviews.Title: “A good option for a car holidays”
Reviews.Author: enona
Reviews.Content: This was part of a car travelling holidays in Italy. The hotel is far from Venice city centre but it's served by a bus stop very close to the hotel and you can reach the city centre on 25/30 minutes. The room has basic furniture, but it was clean and spacious. The breakfast was basic. The hotel includes also a free closed parking space that was very helpful for us.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service!”
Reviews.Author: mas_kjg
Reviews.Content: Hotel Altieri was the perfect place to stay during our short break in Venice. Although not located in the historic centre, it was easily accessible by bus (there are various bus stops down the road from the hotel which take you into Piazza Roma in Venice) The room was lovely and clean but what made this hotel stand out was the superb service we received. Staff at the front desk were incredibly helpful in finding out the best/quickest ways to get to Treviso airport so early in the morning for our flight and also helped us plan an itinerary for our day in Venice. Everyone was so friendly which made our trip so much better. If you are looking for an affordable (important as Venice can get very expensive!), friendly place to stay, Hotel Altieri is the place!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel for good price”
Reviews.Author: afcarter
Reviews.Content: The main reason for choosing this hotel was location for airport as a late flight out and an early morning return flight. However the hotel gave us everything you could need for a short break away. The room was clean and comfortable with a nice on suite bathroom. There was a good choice of breakfast every morning. The staff were always very helpful. To get into Venice it self from the hotel again was very easy, with a choice of buses less than a 100 metres from the hotel, the number 19 being the quickest but only running every 30 minutes. The other choice of busâ€™s being either number 4 or 4/ both taking slightly longer but more frequent, and running later in the evening so enabling you to stay in Venice till late. The Venice travel cards offer very good value for money and give you unlimited travel for the duration of the ticket that you buy, and if you buy more than 2 weeks I advance offer even better value for money. On the whole would really recommend this hotel for a short break to Venice.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Altieri
HotelInfo.Address: Via Altinia 51, 30030 Venice, Italy
